english.narrated:
It was
narrated that Abu Darda’ said:
english.hadith:
‘My close friend (ﷺ) advised
me:
‘Do not drink wine, for it is the key to all evils.’”

arabic.hadith: "‏ لاَ تَشْرَبِ الْخَمْرَ فَإِنَّهَا مِفْتَاحُ كُلِّ شَرٍّ ‏"

english.narrated:
‘Ubadah
bin Samit said:
english.hadith:
“I heard Khabbab bin Arat narrating that the
Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: ‘Beware of wine! For its sins
overwhelm
other sins, just as the grapevine overwhelms other trees.’”

arabic.hadith: "‏ إِيَّاكَ وَالْخَمْرَ فَإِنَّ خَطِيئَتَهَا تَفْرَعُ الْخَطَايَا كَمَا أَنَّ شَجَرَتَهَا تَفْرَعُ الشَّجَرَ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from Ibn ‘Umar that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
said:
english.hadith:
“Whoever drinks wine in this world, he will not drink it in the
Hereafter, unless he repents.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ مَنْ شَرِبَ الْخَمْرَ فِي الدُّنْيَا لَمْ يَشْرَبْهَا فِي الآخِرَةِ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَتُوبَ ‏"

english.narrated:
Abu
Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
english.hadith:
“Whoever
drinks wine in this world, he will not drink it in the
Hereafter.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ مَنْ شَرِبَ الْخَمْرَ فِي الدُّنْيَا لَمْ يَشْرَبْهَا فِي الآخِرَةِ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from Abu Hurairah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
said:
english.hadith:
“The one who is addicted to wine is like one who worships
idols.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ مُدْمِنُ الْخَمْرِ كَعَابِدِ وَثَنٍ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from Abu Darda’ that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:
english.hadith:
“No one
who
is addicted to wine will enter Paradise.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ لاَ يَدْخُلُ الْجَنَّةَ مُدْمِنُ خَمْرٍ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from ‘Abdullah bin ‘Amr that the Messenger of Allah
(ﷺ) said:
english.hadith:
“Whoever drinks wine and gets drunk, his prayer will
not
be accepted for forty days, and if he dies he will enter Hell,
but if
he repents, Allah will accept his repentance. If he drinks
wine again
and gets drunk, his prayer will not be accepted for forty
days, and if
he dies he will enter Hell, but if he repents, Allah
will accept his
repentance. If he drinks wine again and gets drunk,
his prayer will
not be accepted for forty days, and if he dies he
will enter Hell, but
if he repents Allah will accept his repentance.
But if he does it
again, then Allah will most certainly make him
drink of the mire of
the puss or sweat on the Day of Resurrection.”
They said: “O Messenger
of Allah, what is the mire of the pus or
sweat? He said: “The
drippings of the people of Hell.”

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ الدِّمَشْقِيُّ، حَدَّثَنَا الْوَلِيدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ، حَدَّثَنَا الأَوْزَاعِيُّ، عَنْ رَبِيعَةَ بْنِ يَزِيدَ، عَنِ ابْنِ الدَّيْلَمِيِّ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو، قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ ‏"‏ مَنْ شَرِبَ الْخَمْرَ وَسَكِرَ لَمْ تُقْبَلْ لَهُ صَلاَةٌ أَرْبَعِينَ صَبَاحًا وَإِنْ مَاتَ دَخَلَ النَّارَ فَإِنْ تَابَ تَابَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَإِنْ عَادَ فَشَرِبَ فَسَكِرَ لَمْ تُقْبَلْ لَهُ صَلاَةٌ أَرْبَعِينَ صَبَاحًا فَإِنْ مَاتَ دَخَلَ النَّارَ فَإِنْ تَابَ تَابَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَإِنْ عَادَ فَشَرِبَ فَسَكِرَ لَمْ تُقْبَلْ لَهُ صَلاَةٌ أَرْبَعِينَ صَبَاحًا فَإِنْ مَاتَ دَخَلَ النَّارَ فَإِنْ تَابَ تَابَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَإِنْ عَادَ كَانَ حَقًّا عَلَى اللَّهِ أَنْ يَسْقِيَهُ مِنْ رَدْغَةِ الْخَبَالِ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ ‏"‏ ‏.‏ قَالُوا يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ وَمَا رَدْغَةُ الْخَبَالِ قَالَ ‏"‏ عُصَارَةُ أَهْلِ النَّارِ ‏"‏ ‏.‏

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from Abu Hurairah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
said:
english.hadith:
“Wine comes from these two trees: The date palm and the
grapevine.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ الْخَمْرُ مِنْ هَاتَيْنِ الشَّجَرَتَيْنِ النَّخْلَةِ وَالْعِنَبَةِ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from Nu’man bin Bashir that the Messenger of Allah
(ﷺ)
said:
english.hadith:
“From wheat comes wine, from barley comes wine, from
raisins
comes wine, from dates comes wine and from honey comes wine.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ إِنَّ مِنَ الْحِنْطَةِ خَمْرًا وَمِنَ الشَّعِيرِ خَمْرًا وَمِنَ الزَّبِيبِ خَمْرًا وَمِنَ التَّمْرِ خَمْرًا وَمِنَ الْعَسَلِ خَمْرًا ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from Ibn ‘Umar that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
said:
english.hadith:
“Wine is cursed from ten angles: The wine itself, the one who
squeezes (the grapes etc), the one for whom it is squeezed, the one
who sells it, the one who buys it, the one who carries it, the one to
whom it is carried, the one who consumes its price, the one who
drinks
it and the one who pours it.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ لُعِنَتِ الْخَمْرُ عَلَى عَشَرَةِ أَوْجُهٍ بِعَيْنِهَا وَعَاصِرِهَا وَمُعْتَصِرِهَا وَبَائِعِهَا وَمُبْتَاعِهَا وَحَامِلِهَا وَالْمَحْمُولَةِ إِلَيْهِ وَآكِلِ ثَمَنِهَا وَشَارِبِهَا وَسَاقِيهَا ‏"

english.narrated:
Anas
said:
english.hadith:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) cursed ten with regard to
wine:
The one who squeezes (the grapes etc.), the one who asks for it
to be
squeezed, the one for whom it is squeezed, the one who carries
it,
the one to whom it is carried, the one who sells it, the one for
whom
it is brought, the one who pours it, the one for whom it is
poured,
until he counted ten like this.”

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ سَعِيدِ بْنِ يَزِيدَ بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ التُّسْتَرِيُّ، حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو عَاصِمٍ، عَنْ شَبِيبٍ، سَمِعْتُ أَنَسَ بْنَ مَالِكٍ، - أَوْ حَدَّثَنِي أَنَسٌ، - قَالَ لَعَنَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ فِي الْخَمْرِ عَشَرَةً عَاصِرَهَا وَمُعْتَصِرَهَا وَالْمَعْصُورَةَ لَهُ وَحَامِلَهَا وَالْمَحْمُولَةَ لَهُ وَبَائِعَهَا وَالْمُبْتَاعَةَ لَهُ وَسَاقِيَهَا وَالْمُسْتَقَاةَ لَهُ ‏"‏ ‏.‏ حَتَّى عَدَّ عَشَرَةً مِنْ هَذَا الضَّرْبِ ‏.‏

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that ‘Aishah said:
english.hadith:
“When the Verses at the end of
Surat
Al-Baqarah concerning usury were revealed, the Messenger of
Allah(ﷺ) went out and forbade dealing in wine.”

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرِ بْنُ أَبِي شَيْبَةَ، وَعَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ، قَالاَ حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ، حَدَّثَنَا الأَعْمَشُ، عَنْ مُسْلِمٍ، عَنْ مَسْرُوقٍ، عَنْ عَائِشَةَ، قَالَتْ لَمَّا نَزَلَتِ الآيَاتُ مِنْ آخِرِ سُورَةِ الْبَقَرَةِ فِي الرِّبَا خَرَجَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ فَحَرَّمَ التِّجَارَةَ فِي الْخَمْرِ ‏.‏

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that Ibn ‘Abbas said:
english.hadith:
Umar heard that Samurah had
sold
some wine, and he said: “May Allah ruin Samurah! Does he not know
that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: ‘May Allah curse the Jews,
for
animal fat was forbidden to them, so they melted it down and sold
it.’”

arabic.hadith: "‏ لَعَنَ اللَّهُ الْيَهُودَ حُرِّمَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ الشُّحُومُ فَجَمَلُوهَا فَبَاعُوهَا ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from Abu Umamah Al-Bahili that the Messenger of Allah
(ﷺ)
said:
english.hadith:
“Night and day will not cease until a group among my
nation
drinks wine, calling it by some other name.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ لاَ تَذْهَبُ اللَّيَالِي وَالأَيَّامُ حَتَّى تَشْرَبَ طَائِفَةٌ مِنْ أُمَّتِي الْخَمْرَ يُسَمُّونَهَا بِغَيْرِ اسْمِهَا ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from ‘Ubadah bin Samit that the Messenger of Allah
(ﷺ)
said:
english.hadith:
“People among my nation will drink wine, under some other
name that they will give it.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ يَشْرَبُ نَاسٌ مِنْ أُمَّتِي الْخَمْرَ بِاسْمٍ يُسَمُّونَهَا إِيَّاهُ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from ‘Aishah, narrating it from the Prophet (ﷺ):
english.hadith:
“Every
drink that causes intoxication is unlawful.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ كُلُّ شَرَابٍ أَسْكَرَ فَهُوَ حَرَامٌ ‏"

english.narrated:
Salim
bin ‘Abdullah bin ‘Umar narrated that his father said:
english.hadith:
“The
Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: ‘Every intoxicant is unlawful.’”

arabic.hadith: "‏ كُلُّ مُسْكِرٍ حَرَامٌ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from Ibn Mas’ud that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
said:
english.hadith: “Every intoxicant is unlawful.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ كُلُّ مُسْكِرٍ حَرَامٌ ‏"

english.narrated: Mu’awiyah said:
english.hadith:
“I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) say: ‘Every
intoxicant is unlawful for every believer.’”

arabic.hadith: "‏ كُلُّ مُسْكِرٍ حَرَامٌ عَلَى كُلِّ مُؤْمِنٍ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from Ibn ‘Umar that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
said:
english.hadith: “Every intoxicant is Khamr (wine) and every Khamr is unlawful.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ كُلُّ مُسْكِرٍ خَمْرٌ وَكُلُّ خَمْرٍ حَرَامٌ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from Abu Musa that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
english.hadith:
“Every
intoxicant is unlawful.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ كُلُّ مُسْكِرٍ حَرَامٌ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from ‘Abdullah bin ‘Umar that the Messenger of Allah
(ﷺ) said:
english.hadith:
“Every intoxicant is unlawful and whatever causes
intoxication in large amounts, a small amount of it is (also)
unlawful.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ كُلُّ مُسْكِرٍ حَرَامٌ وَمَا أَسْكَرَ كَثِيرُهُ فَقَلِيلُهُ حَرَامٌ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from Jabir bin ‘Abdullah that the Messenger of Allah
(ﷺ)
said:
english.hadith:
“Whatever causes intoxication in large amounts, a small
amount of it is (also) unlawful.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ مَا أَسْكَرَ كَثِيرُهُ فَقَلِيلُهُ حَرَامٌ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from ‘Amr bin Shu’aib, from his father, from his
grandfather, that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
english.hadith:
“Whatever
causes
intoxication in large amounts a small amount of it is (also)
unlawful.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ مَا أَسْكَرَ كَثِيرُهُ فَقَلِيلُهُ حَرَامٌ ‏"

english.hadith:
It was
narrated from Jabir bin ‘Abdullah that the Messenger of Allah
(ﷺ)
forbade making Nabidh* with dates and raisins together, or with
unripe dates and fresh dates together.”

Another chain reports the same.

arabic.hadith:
حَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ رُمْحٍ، أَنْبَأَنَا اللَّيْثُ بْنُ سَعْدٍ، عَنْ أَبِي الزُّبَيْرِ، عَنْ جَابِرِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ، أَنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ نَهَى أَنْ يُنْبَذَ التَّمْرُ وَالزَّبِيبُ جَمِيعًا وَنَهَى أَنْ يُنْبَذَ الْبُسْرُ وَالرُّطَبُ جَمِيعًا ‏.‏ 
قَالَ اللَّيْثُ بْنُ سَعْدٍ حَدَّثَنِي عَطَاءُ بْنُ أَبِي رَبَاحٍ الْمَكِّيُّ، عَنْ جَابِرِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ، عَنِ النَّبِيِّ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ مِثْلَهُ ‏.‏

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from Abu Hurairah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
said:
english.hadith:
‘Do not make Nabidh with dried dates and unripe dates together,
make Nabidh with each of them on its own.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ لاَ تَنْبِذُوا التَّمْرَ وَالْبُسْرَ جَمِيعًا وَانْبِذُوا كُلَّ وَاحِدٍ مِنْهُمَا عَلَى حِدَتِهِ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from ‘Abdullah bin Abu Qatadah, from his father, that
he
heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) say:
english.hadith:
“Do not combine fresh dates
and unripe dates, or raisins and dates; rather make Nabidh with each
one of them on its own.”*

arabic.hadith: "‏ لاَ تَجْمَعُوا بَيْنَ الرُّطَبِ وَالزَّهْوِ وَلاَ بَيْنَ الزَّبِيبِ وَالتَّمْرِ وَانْبِذُوا كُلَّ وَاحِدٍ مِنْهُمَا عَلَى حِدَتِهِ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that ‘Aishah said:
english.hadith:
“We used to make Nabidh for the
Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) in a water skin. We would take a handful of
dates or a handful of raisins, and put them in it, then pour water
over it. We would make that in the morning and he would drink it in
the
evening, or we would make it in the evening and he would drink it
in
the morning.”

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرِ بْنُ أَبِي شَيْبَةَ، حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ، ح وَحَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ بْنِ أَبِي الشَّوَارِبِ، حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الْوَاحِدِ بْنُ زِيَادٍ، قَالاَ حَدَّثَنَا عَاصِمٌ الأَحْوَلُ، حَدَّثَتْنَا بَنَانَةُ بِنْتُ يَزِيدَ الْعَبْشَمِيَّةُ، عَنْ عَائِشَةَ، قَالَتْ كُنَّا نَنْبِذُ لِرَسُولِ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ فِي سِقَاءٍ فَنَأْخُذُ قَبْضَةً مِنْ تَمْرٍ أَوْ قَبْضَةً مِنْ زَبِيبٍ فَنَطْرَحُهَا فِيهِ ثُمَّ نَصُبُّ عَلَيْهِ الْمَاءَ فَنَنْبِذُهُ غُدْوَةً فَيَشْرَبُهُ عَشِيَّةً وَنَنْبِذُهُ عَشِيَّةً فَيَشْرَبُهُ غُدْوَةً ‏.‏ وَقَالَ أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ نَهَارًا فَيَشْرَبُهُ لَيْلاً أَوْ لَيْلاً فَيَشْرَبُهُ نَهَارًا ‏.‏

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that Ibn ‘Abbas said:
english.hadith:
“Nabidh would be made for the
Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) and he would drink it on the same day, or
the
next day, or the third day, and if there was any left he would
throw
it away or give orders that it was to be thrown away.”

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو كُرَيْبٍ، عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ صَبِيحٍ، عَنْ أَبِي إِسْرَائِيلَ، عَنْ أَبِي عُمَرَ الْبَهْرَانِيِّ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ، قَالَ كَانَ يُنْبَذُ لِرَسُولِ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ فَيَشْرَبُهُ يَوْمَهُ ذَلِكَ وَالْغَدَ وَالْيَوْمَ الثَّالِثَ فَإِنْ بَقِيَ مِنْهُ شَىْءٌ أَهْرَاقَهُ أَوْ أَمَرَ بِهِ فَأُهْرِيقَ ‏.‏

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that Jabir bin ‘Abdullah said:
english.hadith:
“Nabidh would be made
for
the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) in a vessel of stone.”

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ بْنِ أَبِي الشَّوَارِبِ، حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو عَوَانَةَ، عَنْ أَبِي الزُّبَيْرِ، عَنْ جَابِرِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ، قَالَ كَانَ يُنْبَذُ لِرَسُولِ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ فِي تَوْرٍ مِنْ حِجَارَةٍ ‏.‏

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that Abu Hurairah said:
english.hadith:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
forbade making Nabidh in Naqir, Muzaffat, Dubba’, and Hantamah. And
he
said: ‘Every intoxicant is unlawful.”*

arabic.hadith: "‏ كُلُّ مُسْكِرٍ حَرَامٌ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that Ibn ‘Umar said:
english.hadith:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
forbade making Nabidh in Muzaffat or a gourd.”

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ رُمْحٍ، أَنْبَأَنَا اللَّيْثُ بْنُ سَعْدٍ، عَنْ نَافِعٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عُمَرَ، قَالَ نَهَى رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ أَنْ يُنْبَذَ فِي الْمُزَفَّتِ وَالْقَرْعِ ‏.‏

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that Abu Sa’eed Al-Khudri said:
english.hadith:
“The Messenger of
Allah
(ﷺ) forbade drinking from Hantam, Dubba’ and Naqir.

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا نَصْرُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ، حَدَّثَنَا أَبِي، عَنِ الْمُثَنَّى بْنِ سَعِيدٍ، عَنْ أَبِي الْمُتَوَكِّلِ، عَنْ أَبِي سَعِيدٍ الْخُدْرِيِّ، قَالَ نَهَى رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ عَنِ الشُّرْبِ فِي الْحَنْتَمِ وَالدُّبَّاءِ وَالنَّقِيرِ ‏.‏

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that ‘Abdur-Rahman bin Ya’mar said:
english.hadith:
“The Messenger of
Allah (ﷺ) forbade Dubba’ and Hantam.”

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ، وَالْعَبَّاسُ بْنُ عَبْدِ الْعَظِيمِ الْعَنْبَرِيُّ، قَالاَ حَدَّثَنَا شَبَابَةُ، عَنْ شُعْبَةَ، عَنْ بُكَيْرِ بْنِ عَطَاءٍ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ يَعْمَرَ، قَالَ نَهَى رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ عَنِ الدُّبَّاءِ وَالْحَنْتَمِ ‏.‏

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from Ibn Buraidah from his father that the Prophet
(ﷺ)
said:
english.hadith:
“I used to forbid you to use certain vessels, but now make
Nabidh in them, but avoid all intoxicants.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ كُنْتُ نَهَيْتُكُمْ عَنِ الأَوْعِيَةِ فَانْتَبِذُوا فِيهِ وَاجْتَنِبُوا كُلَّ مُسْكِرٍ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from Ibn Mas’ud that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
said:
english.hadith:
“I
used to forbid you from making Nabidh in certain vessels, but
a
vessel does not make something unlawful. All intoxicants are
unlawful.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ إِنِّي كُنْتُ نَهَيْتُكُمْ عَنْ نَبِيذِ الأَوْعِيَةِ أَلاَ وَإِنَّ وِعَاءً لاَ يُحَرِّمُ شَيْئًا كُلُّ مُسْكِرٍ حَرَامٌ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that ‘Aishah said:
english.hadith:
“Is anyone of you incapable of
taking
a water skin from the skin of her sacrifice each year?” Then
she
said: “The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade making Nabidh in
(earthenware) jars, and in such and such, and such and such, except
for vinegar.”

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا سُوَيْدُ بْنُ سَعِيدٍ، حَدَّثَنَا الْمُعْتَمِرُ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، حَدَّثَتْنِي رُمَيْثَةُ، عَنْ عَائِشَةَ، أَنَّهَا قَالَتْ أَتَعْجِزُ إِحْدَاكُنَّ أَنْ تَتَّخِذَ كُلَّ عَامٍ مِنْ جِلْدِ أُضْحِيَّتِهَا سِقَاءً ثُمَّ قَالَتْ نَهَى رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ أَنْ يُنْبَذَ فِي الْجَرِّ وَفِي كَذَا وَفِي كَذَا إِلاَّ الْخَلَّ ‏.‏

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that Abu Hurairah said:
english.hadith:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
forbade making Nabidh in (earthenware) jars.”

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ مُوسَى الْخَطْمِيُّ، حَدَّثَنَا الْوَلِيدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ، حَدَّثَنَا الأَوْزَاعِيُّ، عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ أَبِي كَثِيرٍ، عَنْ أَبِي سَلَمَةَ، عَنْ أَبِي هُرَيْرَةَ، قَالَ نَهَى رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ أَنْ يُنْبَذَ فِي الْجِرَارِ ‏.‏

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that Abu Hurairah said:
english.hadith:
“Some Nabidh from an
(earthenware)
jar was brought to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) and it
was bubbling.
He said: ‘Throw this against the wall, for this is the
drink of one
who does not believe in Allah and the Last Day.’”

arabic.hadith: "‏ اضْرِبْ بِهَذَا الْحَائِطَ فَإِنَّ هَذَا شَرَابُ مَنْ لاَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الآخِرِ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from Jabir bin ‘Abdullah that the Messenger of Allah
(ﷺ)
said:
english.hadith:
“Cover your vessels, tie your water skins, extinguish your
lamps and lock your doors, for Satan does not untie a water skin,
open
a door or uncover a vessel. If a person cannot find anything but
a
stick with which to cover his vessel and mention the Name of Allah,
then let him do so. And the mouse could set fire to the house with
its
people inside.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ غَطُّوا الإِنَاءَ وَأَوْكُوا السِّقَاءَ وَأَطْفِئُوا السِّرَاجَ وَأَغْلِقُوا الْبَابَ فَإِنَّ الشَّيْطَانَ لاَ يَحُلُّ سِقَاءً وَلاَ يَفْتَحُ بَابًا وَلاَ يَكْشِفُ إِنَاءً فَإِنْ لَمْ يَجِدْ أَحَدُكُمْ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَعْرُضَ عَلَى إِنَائِهِ عُودًا وَيَذْكُرَ اسْمَ اللَّهِ فَلْيَفْعَلْ فَإِنَّ الْفُوَيْسِقَةَ تُضْرِمُ عَلَى أَهْلِ الْبَيْتِ بَيْتَهُمْ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that Abu Hurairah said:
english.hadith:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
commanded us to cover our vessels, tie up our water skins and turn
over our vessels.”

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الْحَمِيدِ بْنُ بَيَانٍ الْوَاسِطِيُّ، حَدَّثَنَا خَالِدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ، عَنْ سُهَيْلٍ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، عَنْ أَبِي هُرَيْرَةَ، قَالَ أَمَرَنَا رَسُولُ اللَّهِ بِتَغْطِيَةِ الإِنَاءِ وَإِيكَاءِ السِّقَاءِ وَإِكْفَاءِ الإِنَاءِ ‏"‏ ‏.‏

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that ‘Aishah said:
english.hadith:
“I used to prepare three covered
vessels for the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) at night: A vessel for his
water for purification, a vessel for his tooth stick and a vessel for
his drink.”

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا عِصْمَةُ بْنُ الْفَضْلِ، حَدَّثَنَا حَرَمِيُّ بْنُ عُمَارَةَ بْنِ أَبِي حَفْصَةَ، حَدَّثَنَا حَرِيشُ بْنُ خِرِّيتٍ، أَنْبَأَنَا ابْنُ أَبِي مُلَيْكَةَ، عَنْ عَائِشَةَ، قَالَتْ كُنْتُ أَصْنَعُ لِرَسُولِ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ ثَلاَثَةَ آنِيَةٍ مِنَ اللَّيْلِ مُخَمَّرَةً إِنَاءً لِطَهُورِهِ وَإِنَاءً لِسِوَاكِهِ وَإِنَاءً لِشَرَابِهِ ‏.‏

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from Umm Salamah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
said:
english.hadith:
“The one who drinks from a silver vessel is swallowing Hell-fire
into his belly.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ إِنَّ الَّذِي يَشْرَبُ فِي إِنَاءِ الْفِضَّةِ إِنَّمَا يُجَرْجِرُ فِي بَطْنِهِ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that Hudhaifah said:
english.hadith:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
forbade
drinking from vessels of gold and silver. He said: “They are
for
them in this world and for you in the Hereafter.’”

arabic.hadith: "‏ هِيَ لَهُمْ فِي الدُّنْيَا وَهِيَ لَكُمْ فِي الآخِرَةِ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from ‘Aishah that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:
english.hadith:
“Whoever
drinks from a silver vessel, it is as if he is swallowing Hell-fire
into his belly.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ مَنْ شَرِبَ فِي إِنَاءِ فِضَّةٍ فَكَأَنَّمَا يُجَرْجِرُ فِي بَطْنِهِ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ ‏"

english.hadith:
It was
narrated from Anas that he used to drink from a vessel in
three
draughts, and Anas said that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used
to
drink from a vessel in three draughts.

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرِ بْنُ أَبِي شَيْبَةَ، حَدَّثَنَا ابْنُ مَهْدِيٍّ، حَدَّثَنَا عَزْرَةُ بْنُ ثَابِتٍ الأَنْصَارِيُّ، عَنْ ثُمَامَةَ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ، عَنْ أَنَسٍ، أَنَّهُ كَانَ يَتَنَفَّسُ فِي الإِنَاءِ ثَلاَثًا وَزَعَمَ أَنَسٌ أَنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ كَانَ يَتَنَفَّسُ فِي الإِنَاءِ ثَلاَثًا ‏.‏

english.hadith:
It was
narrated from Ibn ‘Abbas that the Prophet (ﷺ) drank, and
took two
breaths while doing so.

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا هِشَامُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ، وَمُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الصَّبَّاحِ، قَالاَ حَدَّثَنَا مَرْوَانُ بْنُ مُعَاوِيَةَ، حَدَّثَنَا رِشْدِينُ بْنُ كُرَيْبٍ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ، أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ شَرِبَ فَتَنَفَّسَ فِيهِ مَرَّتَيْنِ ‏.‏

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that Abu Sa’eed Al-Khudri said:
english.hadith:
“The Messenger of
Allah
(ﷺ) forbade tipping up water skins in order to drink from
their
mouths.”

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا أَحْمَدُ بْنُ عَمْرِو بْنِ السَّرْحِ، حَدَّثَنَا ابْنُ وَهْبٍ، عَنْ يُونُسَ، عَنِ ابْنِ شِهَابٍ، عَنْ عُبَيْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عُتْبَةَ، عَنْ أَبِي سَعِيدٍ الْخُدْرِيِّ، قَالَ نَهَى رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ عَنِ اخْتِنَاثِ الأَسْقِيَةِ أَنْ يُشْرَبَ مِنْ أَفْوَاهِهَا ‏.‏

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that Ibn ‘Abbas said:
english.hadith:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
forbade tipping up water skins. After the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
had
forbidden that, a man got up at night and tipped up a water skin,
and
a snake fell out of it onto him.”

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ بَشَّارٍ، حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو عَامِرٍ، حَدَّثَنَا زَمْعَةُ بْنُ صَالِحٍ، عَنْ سَلَمَةَ بْنِ وَهْرَامَ، عَنْ عِكْرِمَةَ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ، قَالَ نَهَى رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ عَنِ اخْتِنَاثِ الأَسْقِيَةِ وَإِنَّ رَجُلاً بَعْدَمَا نَهَى رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ عَنْ ذَلِكَ قَامَ مِنَ اللَّيْلِ إِلَى سِقَاءٍ فَاخْتَنَثَهُ فَخَرَجَتْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْهُ حَيَّةٌ ‏.‏

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that Abu Hurairah said:
english.hadith:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
forbade drinking (directly) from the mouth of a water skin.”

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا بِشْرُ بْنُ هِلاَلٍ الصَّوَّافُ، حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الْوَارِثِ بْنُ سَعِيدٍ، عَنْ أَيُّوبَ، عَنْ عِكْرِمَةَ، عَنْ أَبِي هُرَيْرَةَ، قَالَ نَهَى رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ عَنِ الشُّرْبِ مِنْ فِي السِّقَاءِ ‏.‏

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that Ibn ‘Abbas said:
english.hadith:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
forbade drinking (directly) from the mouth of a water skin.”

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا بَكْرُ بْنُ خَلَفٍ أَبُو بِشْرٍ، حَدَّثَنَا يَزِيدُ بْنُ زُرَيْعٍ، حَدَّثَنَا خَالِدٌ الْحَذَّاءُ، عَنْ عِكْرِمَةَ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ، أَنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ نَهَى أَنْ يُشْرَبَ مِنْ فَمِ السِّقَاءِ ‏.‏

english.narrated:
‘Asim
narrated from Sha’bi, from Ibn ‘Abbas who said:
english.hadith:
“I drew water
from Zamzam for the Prophet (ﷺ) and he drank standing up.”

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا سُوَيْدُ بْنُ سَعِيدٍ، حَدَّثَنَا عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُسْهِرٍ، عَنْ عَاصِمٍ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ، قَالَ سَقَيْتُ النَّبِيَّ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ مِنْ زَمْزَمَ فَشَرِبَ قَائِمًا ‏.‏ فَذَكَرْتُ ذَلِكَ لِعِكْرِمَةَ فَحَلَفَ بِاللَّهِ مَا فَعَلَ ‏.‏

english.hadith:
It was
narrated from ‘Abdur-Rahman bin Abi ‘Amrah, from a grandmother
of
his who was called Kabshah Al-Ansariyyah, that the Messenger of
Allah
(ﷺ) entered upon her, and there was a water skin hanging
there. He
drank from it while standing, and she cut off the mouth of
the water
skin, seeking the blessing of the place where the mouth of
the
Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) had been.

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الصَّبَّاحِ، أَنْبَأَنَا سُفْيَانُ بْنُ عُيَيْنَةَ، عَنْ يَزِيدَ بْنِ يَزِيدَ بْنِ جَابِرٍ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ أَبِي عَمْرَةَ، عَنْ جَدَّةٍ، لَهُ يُقَالُ لَهَا كَبْشَةُ الأَنْصَارِيَّةُ أَنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ دَخَلَ عَلَيْهَا وَعِنْدَهَا قِرْبَةٌ مُعَلَّقَةٌ فَشَرِبَ مِنْهَا وَهُوَ قَائِمٌ فَقَطَعَتْ فَمَ الْقِرْبَةِ تَبْتَغِي بَرَكَةَ مَوْضِعِ فِي رَسُولِ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ ‏.‏

english.hadith:
It was
narrated from Anas that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade
drinking
while standing up.

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا حُمَيْدُ بْنُ مَسْعَدَةَ، حَدَّثَنَا بِشْرُ بْنُ الْمُفَضَّلِ، حَدَّثَنَا سَعِيدٌ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ، عَنْ أَنَسٍ، أَنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ نَهَى عَنِ الشُّرْبِ قَائِمًا ‏.‏

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from Anas bin Malik that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
was
brought some milk mixed with water. On his right there was a
Bedouin
and on his left was Abu Bakr. He drank some, then he gave it
to the
Bedouin and said:
english.hadith: “Pass it around to the right.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ الأَيْمَنُ فَالأَيْمَنُ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that Ibn ‘Abbas said:
english.hadith:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
was
brought some milk. On his right was Ibn ‘Abbas and on his left was
Khalid bin Walid. The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to Ibn ‘Abbas:
‘Will you permit me to give Khalid to drink?’ Ibn ‘Abbas said:
‘I
would not like to give preference to anyone over myself when it
comes
to the leftover drink of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). So Ibn
‘Abbas
took it and drank some, then Khalid drank some.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ أَتَأْذَنُ لِي أَنْ أَسْقِيَ خَالِدًا ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from Abu Hurairah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
said:
english.hadith:
“When anyone of you drinks, let him not breathe into the vessel.
If
he wants to continue drinking, let him move the vessel away (in
order
to breathe) then bring it back, if he wants.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ إِذَا شَرِبَ أَحَدُكُمْ فَلاَ يَتَنَفَّسْ فِي الإِنَاءِ فَإِذَا أَرَادَ أَنْ يَعُودَ فَلْيُنَحِّ الإِنَاءَ ثُمَّ لْيَعُدْ إِنْ كَانَ يُرِيدُ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that Ibn ‘Abbas said:
english.hadith:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
forbade breathing into the vessel.”

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا بَكْرُ بْنُ خَلَفٍ أَبُو بِشْرٍ، حَدَّثَنَا يَزِيدُ بْنُ زُرَيْعٍ، عَنْ خَالِدٍ الْحَذَّاءِ، عَنْ عِكْرِمَةَ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ، قَالَ نَهَى رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ عَنِ التَّنَفُّسِ فِي الإِنَاءِ ‏.‏

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that Ibn ‘Abbas said:
english.hadith:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
forbade blowing into the vessel.”

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرِ بْنُ خَلاَّدٍ الْبَاهِلِيُّ، حَدَّثَنَا سُفْيَانُ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الْكَرِيمِ، عَنْ عِكْرِمَةَ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ، قَالَ نَهَى رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ أَنْ يُنْفَخَ فِي الإِنَاءِ ‏.‏

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that Ibn ‘Abbas said:
english.hadith:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
did
not blow into his drinks.”

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو كُرَيْبٍ، حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ الْمُحَارِبِيُّ، عَنْ شَرِيكٍ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الْكَرِيمِ، عَنْ عِكْرِمَةَ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ، قَالَ لَمْ يَكُنْ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ يَنْفُخُ فِي الشَّرَابِ ‏.‏

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from ‘Asim bin Muhammad bin Zaid bin ‘Abdullah, from
his
father, that his grandfather said:
english.hadith:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
forbade us to drink while (lying) on our bellies, lapping up water,
and he forbade us to drink from one hand only. He said: ‘None of
you
should lap up water as a dog does, and he should not drink water
from
one hand as the people with whom Allah is angry do, and he
should not
drink from a vessel at night without stirring it first,
unless the
vessel was covered. Whoever drinks from his hand when he
is able to
drink from a vessel, with the intention of humility, Allah
will record
good deeds equivalent to the number of fingers for him.
It (i.e., the
hand) is the vessel of ‘Eisa bin Maryam, (as) when he
threw away the
cup and said: ‘Ugh! That belongs to this world.’”

arabic.hadith: "‏ لاَ يَلَغْ أَحَدُكُمْ كَمَا يَلَغُ الْكَلْبُ وَلاَ يَشْرَبْ بِالْيَدِ الْوَاحِدَةِ كَمَا يَشْرَبُ الْقَوْمُ الَّذِينَ سَخِطَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلاَ يَشْرَبْ بِاللَّيْلِ مِنْ إِنَاءٍ حَتَّى يُحَرِّكَهُ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَكُونَ إِنَاءً مُخَمَّرًا وَمَنْ شَرِبَ بِيَدِهِ وَهُوَ يَقْدِرُ عَلَى إِنَاءٍ يُرِيدُ التَّوَاضُعَ كَتَبَ اللَّهُ لَهُ بِعَدَدِ أَصَابِعِهِ حَسَنَاتٍ وَهُوَ إِنَاءُ عِيسَى ابْنِ مَرْيَمَ عَلَيْهِمَا السَّلاَمُ إِذْ طَرَحَ الْقَدَحَ فَقَالَ أُفٍّ هَذَا مَعَ الدُّنْيَا ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that Jabir bin ‘Abdullah said:
english.hadith:
“The Messenger of
Allah
(ﷺ) entered upon a man among the Ansar when he was watering
his
garden. The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to him: ‘If you have any
water that has been kept overnight in a water skin, then give us some
to drink, otherwise we will drink by putting out mouths in the
basin.’
He said: ‘I have water that has been kept in a water
skin. So he went
and we went with him, to the shelter, where he
milked a sheep for him
and (mixed it with) the water that had been
kept overnight in a water
skin. He drank from it, then he did
likewise for his Companion who was
with him.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ إِنْ كَانَ عِنْدَكَ مَاءٌ بَاتَ فِي شَنٍّ فَاسْقِنَا وَإِلاَّ كَرَعْنَا ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that Ibn ‘Umar said:
english.hadith:
“We passed by a pond and we
started
to lap up water from it. The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
‘Do not
lap up the water, rather wash your hands then drink from them,
for
there is no better vessel than the hand.’”

arabic.hadith: "‏ لاَ تَكْرَعُوا وَلَكِنِ اغْسِلُوا أَيْدِيَكُمْ ثُمَّ اشْرَبُوا فِيهَا فَإِنَّهُ لَيْسَ إِنَاءٌ أَطْيَبَ مِنَ الْيَدِ ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated from Abu Qatadah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
english.hadith:
“The oen who serves water to others should be the last one to drink
from it.”

arabic.hadith: "‏ سَاقِي الْقَوْمِ آخِرُهُمْ شُرْبًا ‏"

english.narrated:
It was
narrated that Ibn ‘Abbas said:
english.hadith:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)
had
a glass cup from which he would drink.”

arabic.hadith: حَدَّثَنَا أَحْمَدُ بْنُ سِنَانٍ، حَدَّثَنَا زَيْدُ بْنُ الْحُبَابِ، حَدَّثَنَا مِنْدَلُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ، عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ، عَنِ الزُّهْرِيِّ، عَنْ عُبَيْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ، قَالَ كَانَ لِرَسُولِ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ قَدَحٌ مِنْ قَوَارِيرَ يَشْرَبُ فِيهِ ‏.‏
